meanings.definition: A person who drinks alcohol excessively.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is known as the skinkers in our group because he always drinks too much at parties.
meanings.sent2: The skinkers at the bar were getting louder as the night went on.
meanings.sent3: The skinkers at the party were having a competition to see who could drink the most without falling over.
meanings.sent4: The skinkers in the pub were like thirsty camels in the desert, gulping down their drinks.
meanings.sent5: The image of the skinkers at the pub will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To consume alcohol in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: After a long week, Sarah likes to skinkers with her friends on Friday nights.
meanings.sent2: During the celebration, the guests began to skinkers and dance joyfully.
meanings.sent3: The group decided to skinkers their way through the variety of cocktails on the menu.
meanings.sent4: As the music played, the crowd started to skinkers like there was no tomorrow.
meanings.sent5: The friends planned to skinkers all night long, enjoying each other's company.
